strings: <se_low>King Trode: What is it!?<page>King Trode: Of all the moments you could possibly have chosen, what on earth made you think that this would be a judicious time to stop for a chat!?

<se_low>King Trode: Now is the time for action, not words!
So get up there and investigate that floating monstrosity, before you lose your nerve!
<se_high>Jessica: It's quite amazing when you think about how far we've come on our journey.

<se_high>Jessica: I'm not just talking about distance, of course.
I mean, we're actually quite close to Alexandria at the moment.

<se_low>Yangus: We've run around all over the world, crossed
the oceans an' flown about in the skies.
An' you've been wiv me all the way, eh guv?

<se_low>Yangus: Now we've just gotta get rid o' this 'igh 'n' mighty Lord o' Darkness...<page>Yangus: ...an' we can get down the pub for a few jars an' a chat about all wot we've been through together!

<se_def>Angelo: What are we still doing here?
I'm all for enjoying a few distractions here and there, but this isn't the time.
<se_low>King Trode: I don't know what would've become of us if Empyrea hadn't arrived so expediently.

<se_low>King Trode: Fortunately for us, however, she did.
And confirmed my suspicions that Rhapthorne is an utter nincompoop at the same time!<page>King Trode: Only a completely incompetent warlord would allow his sworn enemy to slip in with his closest allies!
<se_high>Jessica: This is it! I know, I thought the same thing back when we were fighting Dhoulmagus...and when we were fighting Rhapthorne in his citadel...

<se_high>Jessica: But this time, this really IS it.
If we can beat Rhapthorne once and for all, I'll finally have avenged my brother's death... I hope.
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't been stopped by nuffin' yet.
<se_low>Yangus: That fat lump o' lard don't know who 'e's dealin' wiv! Let's show 'im wot you an' me can do, eh guv?
<se_def>Angelo: What's there to think about? We've just got to make up our minds to take the plunge and go and see Empyrea. The rest will just follow.
<se_low>King Trode: (Mutter, mutter. Mutter, mutter.)

<se_low>King Trode: (Mutter, mutter...)
Kindly refrain from engaging me in conversation! I must concentrate!

<se_low>King Trode: I'm employing the little-known Trodainian art of mind over matter to launch a crippling attack on Rhapthorne.<page>King Trode: He shan't recover from this in a hurry,
I assure you!
(Mutter, mutter...)
<se_high>Jessica: ...So if we defeat the Lord of Darkness, will that make us as legendary as the seven sages?
<se_high>Jessica: Then again, they don't really seem to be all that famous. So I suppose we won't be, either.
<se_low>Yangus: It's all well an' good bein' able to fly an' that, but it don't mean you shouldn't use yer pins ev'ry now an' then.
<se_low>Yangus: Walkin' around's the best way to travel, if you ask me. Really makes ya feel like yer on a journey.
<se_def>Angelo: Being around these parts brings back memories of Dominico.

<se_def>Angelo: He's got the right idea. When all this is over,
I think I'll take a leaf out of his book...<page>Angelo: ...and establish myself as a domestic despot, with an empire stretching all the way to the inside of my own front door.

<se_low>King Trode: You're thinking of a spot of training before we tackle Rhapthorne, are you? Yes, good thinking.<page>King Trode: The monsters around these parts are very tough.
They'll make fine sparring partners.

<se_low>King Trode: Well get to it, then!
Just be sure you don't die!
<se_high>Jessica: It just hit me. One day this journey of ours is going to come to an end.

<se_high>Jessica: Of course, I don't mean that's a bad thing.
But I can't help feeling a little sad about it.
<se_low>Yangus: I weren't too 'appy the first time we come through 'ere. I don't like places where I can't pick up no 'int of 'uman life.

<se_low>Yangus: I'm pretty well tuned in to that kinda thing, y'know, so I don't miss much.<page>Yangus: Course, I was a bit off in Tryan Gully.
I didn't get a sniff o' that place 'til we was standin in it!
<se_def>Angelo: We don't know what kind of attack might be launched from that floating rock on the world below.
<se_def>Angelo: And it would be far better if we never found out. There's no time to lose.

<se_low>King Trode: You're thinking of a spot of training before we tackle Rhapthorne, are you? Yes, good thinking.<page>King Trode: The monsters around these parts are very tough.
They'll make fine sparring partners.
<se_low>King Trode: The Lord of Darkness has turned into a rather formidable-looking foe now.<page>King Trode: We could very easily come unstuck if we don't prepare thoroughly enough.
<se_high>Jessica: Does this mean we're nearing the end of our journey?

<se_high>Jessica: Hey, I have an idea!<page>Jessica: Why don't we just keep on travelling around after we take care of the Lord of Darkness?
You know, like a holiday! Hee hee!

<se_low>Yangus: Wotever 'appens at this stage in the game, nuffin' can surprise me no more.
We've seen it all!

<se_def>Angelo: Are you ready?
Let's give that freak something to think about!

<se_def>Angelo: You'd better be prepared, Rhappy!
I always play to win, and my hands are legendarily lucky!
<se_low>King Trode: I suppose the great sages and their heirs will be watching over us now from heaven, spurring us on.

<se_low>King Trode: Or perhaps they're fuming at our party's lack of courage and general incompetence.
Well, anyway...
<se_low>King Trode: Whichever it is, THEY are as dead as doornails, and WE are not! We're the world's only hope now!
<se_low>King Trode: So let's get to it! The enemy awaits you in the heavens, men! Lead your company to battle, <leader>! DIS-MISSED!

<se_high>Jessica: When we first arrived on this continent, I never imagined things would turn out this way.
I mean, it's become a real adventure.

<se_high>Jessica: And I also never expected that we'd become such good friends, <hero>.
Life's funny that way.
<se_low>Yangus: You get used to dealin' wiv ugly customers if ya come from Pickham. Real 'eavyweights, believe me. Mind you...
<se_low>Yangus: ...this one looks seriously heavy and seriously ugly!
<se_def>Angelo: The house is gone, but I think this is more or less where I was born. It was somewhere around here, anyway.

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder about Rhapthorne...
Where does he come from, d'you think?

<se_def>Angelo: Well, I suppose the questions can wait.<page>Angelo: We'll give him such a beating up there,
he'll run back home to mummy in tears.
Then we'll know, won't we!?
<se_low>King Trode: Medea was the spitting image of my late wife, the Queen of Trodain. Ah, she truly was the budding rose of the kingdom!
<se_low>King Trode: But now... That white hair... Those bulgin<endash> er...beautiful eyes... Those...striking...nostrils... Hm?
<se_high>Princess Medea: NEEEEEEIGH...

<se_low>King Trode: Medea!? I, I was merely making a joke!
Just trying to calm the mood, you understand!

<se_low>King Trode: Keep your wits about you! I sense monsters.
And the feeling's becoming more and more acute.<page>King Trode: I suspect there are some strong foes lurking hereabout.
<se_low>King Trode: We should test our strength here. If the enemy's too strong for us, we should retreat.
<se_high>Jessica: When I was a little girl, Alexandria was my entire universe.

<se_high>Jessica: But now that I've really had a chance to see
the world... All of it, from top to bottom,
good to bad...

<se_high>Jessica: I really feel like I've grown up.
It's been a great experience.

<se_low>Yangus: Me legs are killin' me!
Ain't there no sabrecats 'round 'ere or nuffin'?

<se_low>Yangus: There's no point us wearin' ourselves out before the big fight.<page>Yangus: Come on, sabrecat! Show yerself!
Here kitty, kitty, kitty!

<se_def>Angelo: Looks like the King's increased his guard.
We needn't be too concerned about Ascantha.

<se_def>Angelo: Look. Why don't we just forget all these minor concerns and go straight to the heart of the problem?<page>Angelo: All we need to do is pummel Rhapthorne,
and everything else will be fine!

<se_low>King Trode: Oh, the Holy Isle of Neos! What a tragedy!
It used to be such a magnificent place.

<se_low>King Trode: Neos shares the same fate as my poor castle...
Both perhaps irrevocably ruined by that dastardly Dark Lord!
<se_low>King Trode: We MUST be victorious, <leader>, and exact revenge for the people of the Holy Isle, too!

<se_high>Jessica: Wow. Everything's gone.
The city, the shrine...everything.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that they know their sacred Goddess statue was really the Lord of Darkness's tomb all this time, what are people going to believe in?
<se_low>Yangus: So we finally get to see wot the real Rhapthorne looks like!
<se_low>Yangus: The sceptre's gone, all them people who was possessed by it are gone...<page>Yangus: If we do away wiv 'im now, 'e ain't never gonna be able to cause trouble no more!

<se_low>Yangus: So come on, guv! One last time!
Let's give 'im a good ol' Yangus an' <hero>-style poundin'!
<se_def>Angelo: If you're hoping for a chat, you'd better look elsewhere.

<se_low>King Trode: Your Holiness, please protect us!
Protect the brave soldiers of Trodain!
<se_def>Angelo: Sorry, ‘Your Majesty’, but I don't recall signing up in Trodain!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm wiv the guv! I ain't no soldier o' yours, Grandad!

<se_high>Jessica: You can say that again!
I'm just along for the ride!

<se_high>Red: ‘Soldier o' Trodain’? Pull the other one!
I'd rather die takin' out Rhapthorne than
find meself in some stunted, wrinkly old
codger's army!
<se_low>Morrie: Si, I am here as the friend of the champione of my pit! That is the only raisin!
<se_low>King Trode: I was merely saying a prayer for you all!<page>King Trode: Sometimes I wonder why I bother to have SERVANTS at all when they're so ungrateful and downright belligerent!
<se_low>King Trode: If we defeat Rhapthorne and Medea is returned to her two-legged form, she shall have to marry Prince Charmles.

<se_low>King Trode: Hardly a cheering thought.
Oh, dear me...

<se_high>Jessica: Everyone's still grieving over the death of the Lord High Priest.
It's so sad around here.

<se_high>Jessica: We've got the power to do something to cheer them up. Something to make them feel better.
So let's do it.
<se_low>Yangus: Always say a decent prayer an' go for a quick pee before a fight. ...Or is it, say a quick prayer an' 'ave a decent pee?
<se_low>Yangus: Anyway, it's worth workin' out which you wanna do before ya set foot in a church.<page>Yangus: Ya never know 'ow the Goddess'll react if you go splashin' the old 'oly water around!

<se_def>Angelo: It looks like I'm the church delegate.
In the ‘Anti-Rhapthorne Squad’, I mean.
<se_def>Angelo: <Cap><hero> is the Trodainian delegate, Yangus is the bandit delegate, and Jessica is...the feminist delegate, perhaps?

<se_def>Angelo: I'm not sure if that makes for a good mix,
or a terrible combination.

<se_low>Morrie: Hey, casanova, what about me, ay?
You forget the Moro!
<se_def>Angelo: Oh, yes, of course. Well obviously, you're the monstrous delegate. Truly monstrous. ...Sorry, did I say ‘monstrous’? I meant monster, naturally.

<se_low>King Trode: Quite frankly, it would be no bad thing if this entire area were razed to the ground.
Including Pickham.

<se_low>Yangus: Wot!? Wot are you tryin' to say, Grandad!?
I ain't just gonna let that go, y'know!
<se_low>King Trode: Oh, do excuse me! I should refrain from voicing such ‘fantastic’ ideas!
<se_low>Yangus: You should refrain from voicin' anyfin' if you ask me!
<se_low>King Trode: Even a place as miserable as this, where innocent princesses are kidnapped and traded like circus animals, must be protected from Rhapth<endash>

<se_low>King Trode: No, it's no good. I just can't bring myself to say something I don't mean. I detest the place!<page>King Trode: It can go to the dogs for all I care!
Hmph! The dogs would be a step up from the rats who run the place now.
<se_low>Yangus: I really appreciate you thinkin' to come by 'ere before the final showdown wiv the Lord o' Darkness.

<se_low>Yangus: I'll do wotever it takes to save this place from that geezer. Wherever I travel, Pickham's still
me 'ome!
<se_high>Jessica: Did you come all the way out here before the big battle just for Yangus's sake?

<se_high>Jessica: I knew it!
You really are a nice guy, <hero>.
And a great friend.
<se_high>Jessica: You didn't? Well, whatever the case, thanks to you he's over the moon.
<se_def>Angelo: I can smell the wretched stench of beggars' alley from here.

<se_def>Angelo: So, who's up for a visit to old Rhappy's place, then, eh?<page>Angelo: The smell of fear would be preferable to this smell of... Euurrgh! I'm afraid to think about what this place smells of.
<se_low>King Trode: Brrrrr! I-It's so c-c-cold!

<se_low>King Trode: What on earth are we d-doing in this snowy land at a t-time like this?
Are you TRYING to bring on m-my arthritis!?
<se_high>Princess Medea: Neeeigh!
<se_low>King Trode: Oh, my poor Medea! Are you feeling the cold?
<se_low>King Trode: Now then, <leader>, if we have time to wander aimlessly around these parts, then we certainly have time to visit the spring, hm? Think of my poor Medea!
<se_low>King Trode: Brrr, the cold is biting here! Surely if our schedule is such that we can stand around listening to our teeth chattering, we have time to visit the spring, no?
<se_low>Yangus: That nook grass we 'ad before's well out me system now. We better be careful comin' to a freezin' cold place like this.
<se_low>Yangus: It ain't gonna be funny if we all catch colds before we fight the Lord o' Darkness.<page>Yangus: We'll look like prize lemons wiv an 'ankie in one 'and an' a sword in the other!
<se_high>Jessica: Let's g-g-get out of here before my g-g-gums freeze and my t-t-teeth ch-ch-chatter themselves out of my mouth!
<se_high>Jessica: If we don't, I'm going to f-f-freeze to d-d-death before I g-g-get my chance to fight Rhapthorne!
<se_def>Angelo: Seeing the red sky reflected in the snow must've been quite something.

<se_def>Angelo: The whole world <endash> earth and sky <endash> must've had an eerie crimson glow to it...<page>Angelo: Yes, I'd have enjoyed being here for that.
Such a perfect scene to woo a lady!
<se_low>King Trode: Though its rocky cliffs insulate it from the daily bustle of the outside world...<page>King Trode: ...not even the Godbird Island is safe from the menace of Rhapthorne.
<se_low>King Trode: In fact, with its strong ties to Empyrea, I should think it's in more danger than most places.
<se_low>King Trode: Yes, quite a target, I should say. ...Ooh, I've just remembered! Don't we have to be somewhere? Somewhere far away...
<se_low>King Trode: Have you come to report the news of Rhapthorne's resurrection to Empyrea?
<se_low>King Trode: Aren't you forgetting that she's confined to the World of Darkness?<page>King Trode: Keeping her abreast of the situation can be of little help to us.
<se_low>Yangus: Comin' 'ere brings back mem'ries o' chasin' Empyrea's shadow about.

<se_low>Yangus: I could 'ardly breathe by the end of it!
I'd've given 'er a good thump if I'd got 'old of 'er back then!
<se_low>Yangus: This is the world where Rhapthorne was born, ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: Ya can understand why the bloke went off the rails a bit, bein' brought up in a dingy 'ole like this, can't ya?
<se_high>Jessica: Without the soulstone, we wouldn't even be able to face Rhapthorne.
<se_high>Jessica: The ability to fly really comes in handy, doesn't it? I suppose it's also proof of what mortal enemies Empyrea and the Lord of Darkness are.
<se_high>Jessica: We made it all the way to the World of Darkness, but we're stuck on a tiny little island.

<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what the rest of this world is like?
I wish we had more of a chance to explore it...
<se_def>Angelo: Thinking about it, this island's not that far from Neos, is it?
<se_def>Angelo: The people here were lucky not to have been attacked by Rhapthorne straight away.<page>Angelo: I suppose the place must be under Empyrea's protection or something.

<se_def>Angelo: Delaying things by coming all the way here to the World of Darkness at a time like this...
You're one in a million!
<se_def>Angelo: By which I mean, one of the most frivolous time-wasters in a million years!
<se_low>King Trode: Though its rocky cliffs insulate it from the daily bustle of the outside world...<page>King Trode: ...not even the Godbird Island is safe from the menace of Rhapthorne.
<se_low>King Trode: In fact, with its strong ties to Empyrea, I should think it's in more danger than most places.
<se_low>King Trode: Yes, quite a target, I should say. ...Ooh, I've just remembered! Don't we have to be somewhere? Somewhere far away...
<se_low>King Trode: Now that Empyrea has returned to our world, we really have no reason to visit this place any more.

<se_low>King Trode: About-turn!
We're needed in the World of Light!
<se_low>Yangus: Comin' 'ere brings back mem'ries o' chasin' Empyrea's shadow about.

<se_low>Yangus: I could 'ardly breathe by the end of it!
I'd've given 'er a good thump if I'd got 'old of 'er back then!
<se_low>Yangus: This is the world where Rhapthorne was born, ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: Ya can understand why the bloke went off the rails a bit, bein' brought up in a dingy 'ole like this, can't ya?
<se_high>Jessica: Without the soulstone, we wouldn't even be able to face Rhapthorne.
<se_high>Jessica: The ability to fly really comes in handy, doesn't it? I suppose it's also proof of what mortal enemies Empyrea and the Lord of Darkness are.
<se_high>Jessica: We made it all the way to the World of Darkness, but we're stuck on a tiny little island.

<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what the rest of this world is like?
I wish we had more of a chance to explore it...
<se_def>Angelo: Thinking about it, this island's not that far from Neos, is it?
<se_def>Angelo: The people here were lucky not to have been attacked by Rhapthorne straight away.<page>Angelo: I suppose the place must be under Empyrea's protection or something.

<se_def>Angelo: Delaying things by coming all the way here to the World of Darkness at a time like this...
You're one in a million!
<se_def>Angelo: By which I mean, one of the most frivolous time-wasters in a million years!

<se_low>King Trode: If the Lord of Darkness decides to destroy Baccarat, gamblers the world over will be crying into their chips for decades to come.<page>King Trode: That is, unless he obliterates the rest of the world as well, of course... Hmm, not exactly what you'd call a silver lining...
<se_low>Yangus: We was still chasin' Dhoulmagus when we first come 'ere, eh? Right after we got the ship.

<se_low>Yangus: But now we've got bigger fish to fry, eh!?
The Lord o' Darkness, out to destroy the 'ole world!
<se_low>Yangus: Cor! You'd never o' guessed we'd end up facin' someone like that when we was 'ere last, would ya?
<se_high>Jessica: When I first set out on this journey, I thought everything would be over the moment I avenged Alistair's death.
<se_high>Jessica: But now I know that the only way to finish this once and for all is to destroy Rhapthorne.
<se_def>Angelo: Are you hanging around here because you haven't got the guts to step up for the final showdown?

<se_def>Angelo: Get a grip!
We're all dead if you lose your nerve now!

<se_def>Angelo: Listen, we'll be fine. It'll work out somehow.
Now pull yourself together and let's just take the plunge!

<se_def>Angelo: So you're ready, then? Right!
Let's go and show that execrable sack of smugness who's boss!
<se_def>Angelo: If we waste too much time here, old Rhappy will spill his inky brand of havoc all over the world.
<se_low>King Trode: That peculiar spring is near here, if I'm not mistaken.

<se_low>King Trode: Perhaps Medea might have something she'd like to say to you before the final battle, hm?
Let's see, shall we?
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder if that old geezer who lives wiv all the monsters is doin' awright these days?

<se_low>Yangus: It ain't far to 'is place.
Let's go an' say 'ello.

<se_low>Yangus: Huh huh, maybe 'e went to bed one night like normal, an' woke up to find 'e'd been eaten by 'is own monster pets!<page>Yangus: ...Oops! Better not say stuff like that, just in case it turns out to be true!
<se_high>Jessica: The reason that the curse on King Trode and the Princess hasn't been lifted is because Rhapthorne is still alive.
<se_high>Jessica: Once he's gone, the two of them should return to their normal forms.
<se_high>Jessica: When that happens, I suppose we won't need to take Princess Medea to the spring any more.
<se_def>Angelo: We can't just wander around in the forest until Rhapthorne's finished off every other member of the human race.
<se_def>Angelo: We're the only ones in the world with even the slightest chance of stopping him.
<se_low>King Trode: During the immensely trying period when we had to put up with that hideous young Charmles, you did a splendid job of concealing my true identity from him. I want to thank you.

<se_low>King Trode: I should have expressed my gratitude earlier,
but what with all the flapping about hither and thither, I never seemed to be able to find the right time.
<se_low>Yangus: If the Lord o' Darkness does away wiv Argonia, the 'orse-princess won't 'ave to marry that poncy Prince!
<se_low>Yangus: I don't wanna wish no 'arm on no one or nuffin', but wouldn't that be smashin', eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: Coming back here reminds me of when we were dragging Prince Charmless all over the place.
What a headache that was!

<se_def>Angelo: We're on the brink of saving the world,
but hardly a soul recognises us.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought our faces would be known the world over! I had visions of people crowding us wherever we went.
<se_low>King Trode: This is the creepy island where we laid Dhoulmagus to rest, I believe.<page>King Trode: Unless you're looking for inspiration for the next battle, I see no reason to be here!

<se_low>Yangus: That's it! I've got it!
The perfect name for this place!
<se_low>Yangus: ......Dhoulmagus Island!!!

<se_low>Yangus: It just came to me in a flash! It ain't often I get brainwaves like that, but when I do... Cor!
I surprise meself sometimes.
<se_high>Jessica: I've started to hate Dhoulmagus a little less now that I know he was being controlled by someone far worse.
<se_high>Jessica: That's why I'm so totally focused on confronting Rhapthorne now. It's all I can think about.
<se_def>Angelo: Being home to the Dark Ruins, this island must have been a real place of pilgrimage for Rhapthorne's followers.
<se_def>Angelo: It's a bit shocking to think there were people who worshipped him enough to build a shrine in his honour.
<se_low>King Trode: Hm, far be it from me to doubt young Jessica, but there appears to be nothing out of the ordinary here in the desert at present.
<se_low>King Trode: Let us hope nothing untoward occurs, and it ends up simply being a case of an...overly<->creative imagination, hm?
<se_low>King Trode: I don't believe we can put it down to coincidence, Jessica seeing this place in her ‘vision’.
<se_low>King Trode: <Cap><leader>! You know what to do! Explore every nook and cranny of this Dragon Graveyard! Leave no stone unturned!
<se_low>King Trode: Poor Medea seems to struggle on all this sand.
<se_low>King Trode: If we have no particular business to attend to here, perhaps we could go somewhere else?
<se_low>Yangus: The Dragon Graveyard's somewhere right in the middle o' the desert, ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: I definitely reckon that's the place wot Jessica saw. Definitely.

<se_low>Yangus: So it was the Dragon Graveyard, eh? We was
spot on. But there ain't nuffin' 'ere to do wiv
the Lord o' Darkness as far as I can tell.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue 'ow Rhapthorne thinks 'e's gonna destroy the world.
<se_low>Yangus: But I reckon the 'ole place'll end up lookin' a bit like a desert. Just barren all over, like.
<se_high>Jessica: Yes. Yes, this is it, I think. Although I only saw it so fleetingly in that dream <endash> or whatever it was <endash> that I had, I can't say for sure...
<se_high>Jessica: We've come all this way out here. You're not thinking of turning back now, surely?

<se_high>Jessica: Maybe I was wrong, and there's nothing here.
If so, then so be it. But we at least need to rule it out, don't we? We've got to have a thorough look around.

<se_high>Jessica: I thought nothing lived in the desert,
but I was wrong. It's full of life.
<se_high>Jessica: But if Rhapthorne succeeds, even those creatures will be destroyed. And the world will be overrun by hideous monsters...

<se_def>Angelo: I really do detest the desert.
I can't stand getting sand in my mouth.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just get the task at hand over and done with as quickly as possible and leave, shall we? It's the Dragon Graveyard we're investigating, correct?
<se_def>Angelo: Hahhh, here we go, heading into more trouble.
<se_def>Angelo: All right, that's just a hunch. But it's the hunch of someone who has a reputation for hunches that hit the mark.
<se_def>Angelo: Old Rhappy might not bother to attack a place devoid of towns or castles or anything.
<se_def>Angelo: If he decides to embark on his conquest of the world soon, the desert might just be the only refuge.

<se_low>Yangus: It's always nice to be back 'ome, eh?
Makes ya feel all nice an' cosy, like.
<se_high>Jessica: Are you not sure where to go next by any chance, <hero>?

<se_high>Jessica: Some leader you are!
Do you think you're really up to the task?
I'm not so sure.
<se_high>Jessica: If you know where we're going, then pull it together and let's get to it!
<se_def>Angelo: This continent's a bit of a mixed bag when you think about it. I mean, the boring old abbey and scummy Pickham couldn't be more different.

<se_def>Angelo: They're similar in one way, I suppose...
I wouldn't want to live in either of them.
